instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
threads.message:
Grading folks,

This one is doing me in. History LD. Attempting to boot to OSx results in a hanging pinwheel. ASD EFI hangs at "loading video controller devices" yet ASD OS loads without issue. I'm using an external keyboard and mouse so palm rest sensor trips, all other sensors are happy. I'm getting an error,-60 "video controller test failed" for h.264 decoding performance test." All other video tests are are passing.

mem module swap produced no change in asd efi & osx hanging nor the failure of said ASD OS video controller test.

To be honest I don't know how to proceed at this point or whether I even should.

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
threads.message: .336 - pretty sure it's safe from shorted as it powers on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
threads.message:
Gave it another shot with different 8500. Hit and miss access to osx. Mostly miss. still unable to access EFI. Seems deeper than bad/wrong modules? Where can I head to as this juncture?

Really appreciate the help Duke!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
threads.message: You booting from USB? Could be HDD cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> hangs at pinwheel
threads.message: Bad HDD cable or bad RAM slot else this board is junk. I assume you already disconnected airport cable.
